71 
72 // 2007/11/30: rabartl: Below, I had to move the initial declaration of these
73 // non-member template functions outside of the Array class since the Sun
74 // compiler on sass9000 would not accept this. However, this did work on a
75 // number of other compilers such a g++, Intel C++ etc. The old in-class
76 // non-member friend definition is clearly ISO 98 C++ as shown in Item 46 of
77 // "Effective C++: Third Edition". This is not the end of the world but this
78 // is something to remember for this platform.
79

179  // 2007/11/30: rabartl: Below, note that the only reason that these

502 template<class T>
503 ArrayRCP<T> arcp( const RCP<Array<T> > &v )
504 {
505  if ( is_null(v) || !v->size() )
506  return null;
507  return arcpWithEmbeddedObjPostDestroy<T,RCP<Array<T> > >(
508  &(*v)[0], 0, v->size(),
509  v, false
510  );
511 }
512 
513 
519 template<class T>
520 ArrayRCP<const T> arcp( const RCP<const Array<T> > &v )
521 {
522  if ( is_null(v) || !v->size() )
523  return null;
524  return arcpWithEmbeddedObjPostDestroy<const T,RCP<const Array<T> > >(
525  &(*v)[0], 0, v->size(),
526  v, false
527  );
528 }
529 
530 
536 template<class T>
537 ArrayRCP<T> arcpFromArray( Array<T> &a )
538 {
539  if (a.size() == 0)
540  return null;
541 #ifdef TEUCHOS_DEBUG
542  return a.begin(); // Catch dangling reference!
543 #else
544  return arcp(a.getRawPtr(), 0, a.size(), false);
545 #endif
546 }
547 
548 
554 template<class T>
555 ArrayRCP<const T> arcpFromArray( const Array<T> &a )
556 {
557  if (a.size() == 0)
558  return null;
559 #ifdef TEUCHOS_DEBUG
560  return a.begin(); // Catch dangling reference!
561 #else
562  return arcp(a.getRawPtr(), 0, a.size(), false);
563 #endif
564 }

668 template<typename T>
669 std::istringstream& operator>> (std::istringstream& in, Array<T>& array){
670  array = fromStringToArray<T>(in.str());
671  return in;
672 }

679 template<typename T> inline
680 void extractDataFromISS( std::istringstream& iss, T& data )
681 {
682  iss >> data; // Assumes type has operator>>(...) defined!
683 }
684 
691 inline
692 void extractDataFromISS( std::istringstream& iss, std::string& data )
693 {
694  // grab unformatted string.
695  data = iss.str();
696  // remove white space from beginning and end of string.
697  data = Utils::trimWhiteSpace(data);
698 }
699 
709 inline
710 std::string getArrayTypeNameTraitsFormat(){
711  return "Array(*)";
712 }
713 
714 
715 
731 template<typename T>
732 class TEUCHOS_LIB_DLL_EXPORT TypeNameTraits<Array<T> > {
733 public:
734  static std::string name(){
735  std::string formatString = getArrayTypeNameTraitsFormat();
736  size_t starPos = formatString.find("*");
737  std::string prefix = formatString.substr(0,starPos);
738  std::string postFix = formatString.substr(starPos+1);
739  return prefix+TypeNameTraits<T>::name()+postFix;
740  }
741  static std::string concreteName(const Array<T>&)
742  { return name(); }
743 };
744

757 // All constructors
758 
759 
760 template<typename T> inline
761 Array<T>::Array()
762 #ifdef HAVE_TEUCHOS_ARRAY_BOUNDSCHECK
763  : vec_(rcp(new std::vector<T>()))
764 #endif
765 {}
766 
767 
768 template<typename T> inline
769 Array<T>::Array(size_type n, const value_type& value) :
770 #ifdef HAVE_TEUCHOS_ARRAY_BOUNDSCHECK
771  vec_(rcp(new std::vector<T>(n,value)))
772 #else
773  vec_(n, value)
774 #endif
775 {}
776 
777 
778 template<typename T> inline
779 Array<T>::Array(const Array<T>& x) :
780 #ifdef HAVE_TEUCHOS_ARRAY_BOUNDSCHECK
781  vec_(rcp(new std::vector<T>(*x.vec_)))
782 #else
783  vec_(x.vec_)
784 #endif
785 {}
786 
787 
788 template<typename T> template<typename InputIterator> inline
789 Array<T>::Array(InputIterator first, InputIterator last) :
790 #ifdef HAVE_TEUCHOS_ARRAY_BOUNDSCHECK
791  vec_(rcp(new std::vector<T>(first, last)))
792 #else
793  vec_(first, last)
794 #endif
795 {}
796 
797 
798 template<typename T> inline
799 Array<T>::~Array()
800 {}
801 
802 
803 template<typename T> inline
804 Array<T>::Array(const ArrayView<const T>& a)
805 #ifdef HAVE_TEUCHOS_ARRAY_BOUNDSCHECK
806  : vec_(rcp(new std::vector<T>()))
807 #endif
808 {
809  insert(begin(), a.begin(), a.end());
810 }
811 
812 
813 template<typename T>
814 template<int N>
815 inline
816 Array<T>::Array(const Tuple<T,N>& t)
817 #ifdef HAVE_TEUCHOS_ARRAY_BOUNDSCHECK
818  : vec_(rcp(new std::vector<T>()))
819 #endif
820 {
821  insert(begin(), t.begin(), t.end());
822 }

825 template<typename T> inline
826 Array<T>& Array<T>::operator=(const Array& a)
827 {
828  vec(true) = a.vec();
829  return *this;
830 }

836 template<typename T> inline
837 void Array<T>::assign(size_type n, const value_type& val)
838 {
839  vec(true).assign(n,val);
840 }
841 
842 
843 template<typename T> template<typename InputIterator> inline
844 void Array<T>::assign(InputIterator first, InputIterator last)
845 {
846  vec(true).assign(first,last);
847 }
848 
849 
850 template<typename T> inline
851 typename Array<T>::iterator
852 Array<T>::begin()
853 {
854 #ifdef HAVE_TEUCHOS_ARRAY_BOUNDSCHECK
855  if (is_null(extern_arcp_)) {
856  // Here we must use the same RCP to avoid creating two unrelated RCPNodes!
857  extern_arcp_ = arcp(vec_); // Will be null if vec_ is sized!
858  }
859  // Returning a weak pointer will help to catch dangling references but still
860  // keep the same behavior as optimized code.
861  return extern_arcp_.create_weak();
862 #else
863  return vec().begin();
864 #endif
865 }
866 
867 
868 template<typename T> inline
869 typename Array<T>::iterator
870 Array<T>::end()
871 {
872 #ifdef HAVE_TEUCHOS_ARRAY_BOUNDSCHECK
873  return begin() + size();
874 #else
875  return vec().end();
876 #endif
877 }
878 
879 
880 template<typename T> inline
881 typename Array<T>::const_iterator
882 Array<T>::begin() const
883 {
884 #ifdef HAVE_TEUCHOS_ARRAY_BOUNDSCHECK
885  if (is_null(extern_carcp_)) {
886  extern_carcp_ = const_cast<Array<T>*>(this)->begin();
887  }
888  // Returning a weak pointer will help to catch dangling references but still
889  // keep the same behavior as optimized code.
890  return extern_carcp_.create_weak();
891 #else
892  return vec().begin();
893 #endif
894 }
895 
896 
897 template<typename T> inline
898 typename Array<T>::const_iterator
899 Array<T>::end() const
900 {
901 #ifdef HAVE_TEUCHOS_ARRAY_BOUNDSCHECK
902  return begin() + size();
903 #else
904  return vec().end();
905 #endif
906 }

909 template<typename T> inline
910 typename Array<T>::reverse_iterator
911 Array<T>::rbegin()
912 {
913 #ifdef HAVE_TEUCHOS_ARRAY_BOUNDSCHECK
914  return reverse_iterator(end());
915 #else
916  return vec().rbegin();
917 #endif
918 }

921 template<typename T> inline

923 Array<T>::rend()

929 #endif
930 }

1098 template<typename T> inline
1099 void Array<T>::pop_back()
1100 {
1101 #ifdef HAVE_TEUCHOS_ARRAY_BOUNDSCHECK
1102  assertNotNull();
1103 #endif
1104  vec(true).pop_back();
1105 }
1106 
1107 
1108 // 2009/11/13:: rabartl: After moving to a full RCPNode tracing and lookup
1109 // model, I had to how modifying functions like insert(...) and erase(...)
1110 // work which have active iterators controled by the client and yet need to
1111 // allow the structure of the container change. The way these troublesome
1112 // functions work is that first the raw std::vector iterator is extracted.
1113 // The function vec(true, true) then deletes the strong iterators but there is
1114 // still a weak ArrayRCP object that is owned by the client which is being
1115 // passed into this function. The issue is that the design of ArrayRCP is
1116 // such that the RCPNode object is not removed but instead remains in order to
1117 // perform runtime checking.
1118 
1119 
1120 template<typename T> inline
1121 typename Array<T>::iterator
1122 Array<T>::insert(iterator position, const value_type& x)
1123 {
1124 #ifdef HAVE_TEUCHOS_ARRAY_BOUNDSCHECK
1125  // Assert a valid iterator and get vector iterator
1126  const typename std::vector<T>::iterator raw_poss = raw_position(position);
1127  const difference_type i = position - begin();
1128  vec(true, true).insert(raw_poss, x);
1129  return begin() + i;
1130 #else
1131  return vec_.insert(position, x);
1132 #endif
1133 }
1134 
1135 
1136 template<typename T> inline
1137 void Array<T>::insert(iterator position, size_type n, const value_type& x)
1138 {
1139 #ifdef HAVE_TEUCHOS_ARRAY_BOUNDSCHECK
1140  const typename std::vector<T>::iterator raw_poss = raw_position(position);
1141  vec(true, true).insert(raw_poss, n, x);
1142 #else
1143  vec_.insert(position, n, x);
1144 #endif
1145 }
1146 
1147 
1148 template<typename T> template<typename InputIterator> inline
1149 void Array<T>::insert(iterator position, InputIterator first, InputIterator last)
1150 {
1151 #ifdef HAVE_TEUCHOS_ARRAY_BOUNDSCHECK
1152  const typename std::vector<T>::iterator raw_poss = raw_position(position);
1153  vec(true, true).insert(raw_poss, first, last);
1154 #else
1155  vec_.insert(position, first, last);
1156 #endif
1157 }
1158 
1159 
1160 template<typename T> inline
1161 typename Array<T>::iterator
1162 Array<T>::erase(iterator position)
1163 {
1164 #ifdef HAVE_TEUCHOS_ARRAY_BOUNDSCHECK
1165  assertNotNull();
1166  // Assert a valid iterator and get vector iterator
1167  const typename std::vector<T>::iterator raw_poss = raw_position(position);
1168  const difference_type i = position - begin();
1169  vec(true, true).erase(raw_poss);
1170  return begin() + i;
1171 #else
1172  return vec_.erase(position);
1173 #endif
1174 }
1175 
1176 
1177 template<typename T> inline
1178 typename Array<T>::iterator
1179 Array<T>::erase(iterator first, iterator last)
1180 {
1181 #ifdef HAVE_TEUCHOS_ARRAY_BOUNDSCHECK
1182  if (empty()) {
1183  TEUCHOS_ASSERT(first == begin());
1184  TEUCHOS_ASSERT(last == end());
1185  return end();
1186  }
1187  assertNotNull();
1188  // Assert a valid iterator and get vector iterator
1189  const typename std::vector<T>::iterator raw_first = raw_position(first);
1190  const typename std::vector<T>::iterator raw_last = raw_position(last);
1191  const difference_type i = first - begin();
1192  vec(true,true).erase(raw_first,raw_last);
1193  return begin() + i;
1194 #else
1195  return vec_.erase(first,last);
1196 #endif
1197 }
1198 
1199 
1200 template<typename T> inline
1201 void Array<T>::swap(Array& x)
1202 {
1203  vec(true).swap(x.vec());
1204 }
1205 
1206 
1207 template<typename T> inline
1208 void Array<T>::clear()
1209 {
1210  vec(true).clear();
1211 }

1218 Array<T>& Array<T>::append(const T& x)
1219 {
1220  this->push_back(x);
1221  return *this;
1222 }

1224 
1225 template<typename T> inline
1226 void Array<T>::remove(int i)
1227 {
1228 #ifdef HAVE_TEUCHOS_ARRAY_BOUNDSCHECK
1229  assertIndex(i);
1230 #endif
1231  // Erase the i-th element of this array.
1232  this->erase( this->begin() + i );
1233 }

1247 }

1255 #else
1256  return false;
1257 #endif
1258 }

1278 template<typename T> inline
1279 Array<T>::Array( const std::vector<T> &v ) :
1280 #ifdef HAVE_TEUCHOS_ARRAY_BOUNDSCHECK
1281  vec_(new std::vector<T>(v))
1282 #else
1283  vec_(v)
1284 #endif
1285 {}

1287 
1288 template<typename T> inline
1289 std::vector<T> Array<T>::toVector() const
1290 {
1291  if (!size())
1292  return std::vector<T>();
1293  std::vector<T> v(begin(),end());
1294  return v;
1295 }

1299 Array<T>& Array<T>::operator=( const std::vector<T> &v )
1300 {
1301  vec(true) = v;
1302  return *this;
1303 }

1306 // Views
1307 
1308 
1309 template<typename T> inline
1310 ArrayView<T> Array<T>::view( size_type offset, size_type size_in )
1311 {
1312  if (size_in) {
1313 #ifdef HAVE_TEUCHOS_ARRAY_BOUNDSCHECK
1314  return ArrayView<T>(this->begin().persistingView(offset, size_in));
1315 #else
1316  return arrayView( &vec()[offset], size_in );
1317 #endif
1318  }
1319  return Teuchos::null;
1320 }
1321 
1322 
1323 template<typename T> inline
1324 ArrayView<const T> Array<T>::view( size_type offset, size_type size_in ) const
1325 {
1326  if (size_in) {
1327 #ifdef HAVE_TEUCHOS_ARRAY_BOUNDSCHECK
1328  return ArrayView<const T>(this->begin().persistingView(offset, size_in));
1329 #else
1330  return arrayView( &vec()[offset], size_in );
1331 #endif
1332  }
1333  return Teuchos::null;
1334  // NOTE: Above, we use a different implementation to call the const version
1335  // of begin() instead of the non-const version. This sets up a different
1336  // ArrayRCP object that gets checked.
1337 }
1338 
1339 
1340 template<typename T> inline
1341 ArrayView<T> Array<T>::operator()( size_type offset, size_type size_in )
1342 {
1343  return view(offset, size_in);
1344 }
1345 
1346 
1347 template<typename T> inline
1348 ArrayView<const T> Array<T>::operator()( size_type offset, size_type size_in ) const
1349 {
1350  return view(offset, size_in);
1351 }
1352 
1353 
1354 template<typename T> inline
1355 ArrayView<T> Array<T>::operator()()
1356 {
1357  if (!size())
1358  return null;
1359  return this->view(0, size());
1360 }
1361 
1362 
1363 template<typename T> inline
1364 ArrayView<const T> Array<T>::operator()() const
1365 {
1366  if (!size())
1367  return null;
1368  return this->view(0, size());
1369 }
1370 
1371 
1372 template<typename T> inline
1373 Array<T>::operator ArrayView<T>()
1374 {
1375  return this->operator()();
1376 }
1377 
1378 
1379 template<typename T> inline
1380 Array<T>::operator ArrayView<const T>() const
1381 {
1382  return this->operator()();
1383 }
1384 
1385 
1386 // private
1387 
1388 
1389 template<typename T>
1390 std::vector<T>&
1391 Array<T>::vec( bool isStructureBeingModified, bool activeIter )
1392 {
1393 #ifdef HAVE_TEUCHOS_ARRAY_BOUNDSCHECK
1394  (void)activeIter;
1395  if (isStructureBeingModified) {
1396  // Give up my ArrayRCPs used for iterator access since the array we be
1397  // getting modifed! Any clients that have views through weak pointers
1398  // better not touch them!
1399  extern_arcp_ = null;
1400  extern_carcp_ = null;
1401  }
1402  return *vec_;
1403 #else
1404  // get rid of "unused parameter" warnings
1405  (void)isStructureBeingModified;
1406  (void)activeIter;
1407  return vec_;
1408 #endif
1409 }
1410 
1411 
1412 template<typename T> inline
1413 const std::vector<T>&
1414 Array<T>::vec() const
1415 {
1416 #ifdef HAVE_TEUCHOS_ARRAY_BOUNDSCHECK
1417  return *vec_;
1418 #else
1419  return vec_;
1420 #endif
1421 }
1422 
1423 
1424 template<typename T> inline
1425 typename std::vector<T>::iterator
1426 Array<T>::raw_position( iterator position )
1427 {
1428 #ifdef HAVE_TEUCHOS_ARRAY_BOUNDSCHECK
1429  const iterator first = this->begin();
1430  const iterator last = this->end();
1431  TEUCHOS_TEST_FOR_EXCEPTION(
1432  !(first <= position && position <= last), DanglingReferenceError,
1433  "Error, this iterator is no longer valid for this Aray!"
1434  );
1435  // Note, above operator<=(...) functions will throw
1436  // IncompatibleIteratorsError if the iterators do not share the same
1437  // RCP_node object!
1438  return vec_->begin() + (position - this->begin());
1439 #else
1440  return position;
1441 #endif
1442 }
1443 
1444 
1445 template<typename T> inline
1446 void Array<T>::assertIndex(int i) const
1447 {
1448  TEUCHOS_TEST_FOR_EXCEPTION(
1449  !( 0 <= i && i < length() ), RangeError,
1450  "Array<T>::assertIndex(i): i="<<i<<" out of range [0, "<< length() << ")"
1451  );
1452 }
1453 
1454 
1455 template<typename T> inline
1456 void Array<T>::assertNotNull() const
1457 {
1458  TEUCHOS_TEST_FOR_EXCEPTION(
1459  !size(), NullReferenceError,
1460  typeName(*this)<<"::assertNotNull(): "
1461  "Error, the array has size zero!"
1462  );
1463 }

1516 template<typename T> inline
1517 int Teuchos::hashCode(const Array<T>& array)
1518 {
1519  int rtn = hashCode(array.length());
1520  for (int i=0; i<array.length(); i++)
1521  {
1522  rtn += hashCode(array[i]);
1523  }
1524  return rtn;
1525 }

1540 
1541 
1542 template<typename T>
1543 Teuchos::Array<T>
1544 Teuchos::fromStringToArray(const std::string& arrayStr)
1545 {
1546  const std::string str = Utils::trimWhiteSpace(arrayStr);
1547  std::istringstream iss(str);
1548  TEUCHOS_TEST_FOR_EXCEPTION(
1549  ( str[0]!='{' || str[str.length()-1] != '}' )
1550  ,InvalidArrayStringRepresentation
1551  ,"Error, the std::string:\n"
1552  "----------\n"
1553  <<str<<
1554  "\n----------\n"
1555  "is not a valid array represntation!"
1556  );
1557  char c;
1558  c = iss.get(); // Read initial '{'
1559  TEUCHOS_TEST_FOR_EXCEPT(c!='{'); // Should not throw!
1560  // Now we are ready to begin reading the entries of the array!
1561  Array<T> a;
1562  while( !iss.eof() ) {
1563  // Get the basic entry std::string
1564  std::string entryStr;
1565  std::getline(iss,entryStr,','); // Get next entry up to ,!
1566  // ToDo: Above, we might have to be careful to look for the opening and
1567  // closing of parentheses in order not to pick up an internal ',' in the
1568  // middle of an entry (for a std::complex number for instance). The above
1569  // implementation assumes that there will be no commas in the middle of
1570  // the std::string representation of an entry. This is certainly true for
1571  // the types bool, int, float, and double.
1572  //
1573  // Trim whitespace from beginning and end
1574  entryStr = Utils::trimWhiteSpace(entryStr);
1575  TEUCHOS_TEST_FOR_EXCEPTION(
1576  0 == entryStr.length(),
1577  InvalidArrayStringRepresentation,
1578  "Error, the std::string:\n"
1579  "----------\n"
1580  <<str<<
1581  "\n----------\n"
1582  "is not a valid array represntation because it has an empty array entry!"
1583  );
1584  // Remove the final '}' if this is the last entry and we did not
1585  // actually terminate the above getline(...) on ','
1586  bool found_end = false;
1587  if(entryStr[entryStr.length()-1]=='}') {
1588  entryStr = entryStr.substr(0,entryStr.length()-1);
1589  found_end = true;
1590  if( entryStr.length()==0 && a.size()==0 )
1591  return a; // This is the empty array "{}" (with any spaces in it!)
1592  }
1593  // Finally we can convert the entry and add it to the array!
1594  std::istringstream entryiss(entryStr);
1595  T entry;
1596  Teuchos::extractDataFromISS( entryiss, entry );
1597  // ToDo: We may need to define a traits class to allow us to specialized
1598  // how conversion from a std::string to a object is done!
1599  a.push_back(entry);
1600  // At the end of the loop body here, if we have reached the last '}'
1601  // then the input stream iss should be empty and iss.eof() should be
1602  // true, so the loop should terminate. We put an std::exception test here
1603  // just in case something has gone wrong.
1604  TEUCHOS_TEST_FOR_EXCEPTION(
1605  found_end && !iss.eof()
1606  ,InvalidArrayStringRepresentation
1607  ,"Error, the std::string:\n"
1608  "----------\n"
1609  <<str<<
1610  "\n----------\n"
1611  "is not a valid array represntation!"
1612  );
1613  }
1614  return a;
1615 }
1616
